ygData.subject: TWINKING-- a discussion
ygData.msgSnippet: OK-- I just wanted to bring this up, because I just had a horrible experience involving twinking. I play a lvl 20 druid, non-twinked, as my primary. My ranger
ygData.messageBody:
OK-- I just wanted to bring this up, because I
just had a horrible experience involving twinking. I
play a lvl 20 druid, non-twinked, as my primary. My
ranger friend and I have been in HighPass Hold for 2
weeks now trying to get Dylln Starshine (or whatever
his name is), so I can get the last part in need for
the coveted Testament of Vanear. The only time we've
ever seen him, he was already camped. <br><br>A few
nights ago, i loged on (my ranger friend wasn't on),
when lo and behold, there he is!! There were only 7
people in the zone. I know I should have shouted that he
was up, and mine, but i was so excited that i memm-d
spells i needed, and went to find the nasty red bandit
guy, so I could harmonize him before i attacked. Found
the bandit, harmoed, came back, and there was a lvl
50 something guy stealing my camp. Turns out this
guy has 2 accounts, and had his alt char. there too
(lvl 5 druid) to get the Testament. I was angry that
my camp was stolen (though i blame myself for not
shouting ownership). But i was more frustrated that this
guy was there only to twink his lower charachter.
<br><br>It reminded me of all the encounters i've had with
twinkers, most of them bad. Twinkers often have little
respect for lower level chars, especially if they have
several high lvls and are just trying to power level this
new char. They, more often then regular players,
steal good mobs for XP. I've grouped with twinkers,
unkowingly, who are godlike at the same level as me, while
the rest of us struggle. It may be sour grapes, but I
think it ruins the experience for others.<br><br>Now,
when I have a couple of lvl 50+ chars, maybe my tune
will change. If i decide to twink a char, though, to
power level, i'll make sure to stay out of REAL
players' ways. I think it sucks for a lvl 50 to come in a
kill a quest mob and deprive the lower levels, for
which the quest is great, the opportunity. Also, i
watched a twinker come in to the camp i was in, wait till
some of us were dead or had to flee, and then jump
into the fray. When I re-zoned, i noticed that ALL of
the slain mobs, even the ones my group had killed,
had been looted. When my group got back to our camp,
the twinker denied our offer to join (said he was
power levelin and didn't want to share xp), and refused
to give up some of the loot that he "stole"
(taunting us with "I'm a master auctioneer, and this stuff
will sell great on the open marke") Some of our group
petitioned him, i just chalked it up to another bad player
experience. <br><br>SO-- what is your thinking on
twinking?<br><br>Do you do it? How severe? Do you twink your own
chars, friends, guildmates? Do you frown on twinkers or
admire them? Do you ever randomly twink a newbie just
because? (Now THAT I think is cool -- offering a lowbie
ONE higher item for doing a minor service) How
impressed are you with the playing ability of a lvl 5
warrior in full bronze armor?<br><br>Xela Orcbane<br>20th
season Druid<br>Guild of the Un-twinked<br>Xev
